intro: Sida callimorpha, commonly known as the woolly sida, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and along riverbanks. Sida callimorpha is an annual herb that is often considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
